Reason: increase funding for Title I and require districts to use these funds to offer educators competitive salaries!
double the number of psychologists, guidance counselors, nurses, social workers, and other health professionals in our schools!
include funding for improving public school buildings in federal infrastructure legislation!
invest in our schools to eliminate the funding gap between white and non-white districts, and rich and poor districts!
create more opportunities for high school students to take practical classes that lead to credentials!
provide two years of community college or other high-quality training programs without debt!
create a new grant program to assist community colleges in improving their students’ success!
make public colleges and universities tuition-free for all families with incomes below $125,000!
increase financial support to low-income and middle-class individuals by doubling the maximum value of Pell grants!
simplify and increase the generosity of today’s income-based repayment program!
stop for-profit education programs from profiteering off of students!
build high tech labs and facilities needed for learning, research, and innovation at HBCUs, TCUs, and MSIs!
